column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////I came here alone while visiting Chicago
column2: but the bill was covered by job
column3: so I figured I would give it a try. It's kind of a darker
column4: intimate place with a earlier 1900's bar kind of vibe. So
column5: a little awkward being by myself
column6: but whatever. I started with the mixed greens apple salad and then had the shortrib stroganoff. Both were excellent. But
column8: even more impressive than the food was the service. This place seems to be run like a well oiled machine. My server was awesome and the rest of the support staff were just as nice and efficient. Oh
column9: and I love their BYOB wine rule - You can bring your own bottle
column10: but then you have to share a glass with another table! Definitely will try to come back here next time in Chicago!
